sentences: Koristage need oksad siit jalust ära!
Viige lapsed jalust ära! Käi jalust!
Tulge siit inimeste jalust ära. Põgenesid sõja, lahingute jalust.
context: The word 'jalust' is an adverb or postposition meaning 'from underfoot', 'out of the way', or used to tell someone to move away from a place. It indicates movement away from someone's feet or out of a particular area, often with the connotation of getting out of someone's personal space or clearing an area.
